name: Anti-Inflammatory Focus
title: Anti-Inflammatory Focus
description: Tailored to your health goals and preferences

meals.food_name: Golden Turmeric Chia Pudding with Omega-3 Boost
meals.description: Creamy overnight chia pudding with anti-inflammatory spices and omega-3 rich seeds
instructions: Mix chia seeds, coconut milk, turmeric, grated ginger, and cinnamon in a bowl
Whisk thoroughly to prevent clumping and let sit for 5 minutes
Whisk again to break up any clumps, then refrigerate overnight
In the morning, stir in honey and top with walnuts, blueberries, and hemp seeds
Serve chilled and enjoy the creamy, anti-inflammatory benefits
meals.goal_alignment: High fiber and healthy fats promote satiety for weight loss. Turmeric and ginger provide powerful anti-inflammatory compounds. Omega-3 rich seeds support heart health and reduce inflammation.

meals.food_name: Mediterranean Raw Zucchini Noodle Bowl with Fermented Vegetables
meals.description: Fresh, raw spiralized zucchini with anti-inflammatory herbs and gut-healthy fermented vegetables
instructions: Spiralize zucchini into noodles using a spiralizer or vegetable peeler
Dice cucumber into small cubes and slice avocado
In a large bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, and sea salt
Add zucchini noodles and cucumber to dressing, toss gently
Top with fresh herbs, sauerkraut, olives, and pumpkin seeds
Add avocado slices just before serving to maintain freshness
Let marinate for 10 minutes before eating to enhance flavors
meals.goal_alignment: Raw vegetables provide maximum nutrients and enzymes. High fiber content promotes satiety and weight management. Fermented sauerkraut supports gut health and immune function.

meals.food_name: Herb-Crusted Salmon with Ginger-Turmeric Cauliflower Rice
meals.description: Omega-3 rich salmon with anti-inflammatory spiced cauliflower rice and leafy greens
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C)
Mix chopped dill, parsley, 1 clove minced garlic, and olive oil to create herb crust
Season salmon with salt and pepper, then coat with herb mixture
Bake salmon for 12-15 minutes until flaky and cooked through
Heat coconut oil in a large pan over medium heat
Add remaining garlic, ginger, and turmeric, sauté for 1 minute until fragrant
Add cauliflower rice, cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring frequently
Add spinach and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes
Season with salt, pepper, and lemon juice
Serve salmon over cauliflower rice, garnish with sliced almonds
meals.goal_alignment: High-quality protein supports muscle maintenance during weight loss. Omega-3 fatty acids reduce inflammation and support heart health. Turmeric and ginger provide powerful anti-inflammatory compounds.

days.day_notes: This day features a perfect balance of raw and cooked foods, with fermented vegetables for gut health. Each meal contains powerful anti-inflammatory ingredients like turmeric, ginger, and omega-3 rich foods. The high fiber content will keep you satisfied while supporting weight loss goals.

variety_score: Excellent variety with different textures, temperatures, and cooking methods. Raw lunch provides maximum nutrients, while cooked dinner offers comfort and warmth. Multiple anti-inflammatory spices and herbs throughout the day.
goal_alignment: This plan perfectly aligns with weight loss goals through high fiber, quality proteins, and healthy fats that promote satiety. Anti-inflammatory ingredients like turmeric, ginger, and omega-3 rich foods support overall health while managing calorie intake for sustainable weight loss.
shopping_tips: Shop for wild-caught salmon at the fish counter for best quality. Buy organic produce when possible, especially for items consumed raw. Purchase raw sauerkraut from the refrigerated section, not shelf-stable versions. Prepare chia pudding the night before for easy breakfast. Pre-spiralize zucchini and store in the refrigerator for quick lunch assembly.
